intro: Acrocephalus capitellatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved water-dropwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in moist environments such as wet meadows and stream banks. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are clustered at the top of the stems. Its botanical features make it an important plant for ecological studies and wetland conservation.
